009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import java.awt.Rectangle;
012
013import ij.ImagePlus;
014import ij.gui.Roi;
015import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017
018/**
019 * This ImageJ plugin shows how an image operation can be confined
020 * to the currently selected region of interest (ROI). Note that
021 * it uses the ROI attached to the associated {@link ImagePlus} instance,
022 * which may be of any shape (not just a rectangle).
023 * The plugin works for RGB color images and merely inverts the
024 * each pixel contained in the ROI.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/04/01
028 */
029public class Roi_Processing_Demo1 implements PlugInFilter {
030
031        private ImagePlus im = null;
032
033        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
034                this.im = im;
035                return DOES_RGB + ROI_REQUIRED;
036        }
037
038        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
039                // The ROI obtained from ImagePlus may be of any type:
040                Roi roi = im.getRoi();  
041                Rectangle bounds = roi.getBounds();
042
043                int rL = bounds.x;
044                int rT = bounds.y;
045                int rR = rL + bounds.width;
046                int rB = rT + bounds.height;
047
048                // Scan the rectangle and process all pixels inside the ROI:
049                for (int v = rT; v < rB; v++) {
050                        for (int u = rL; u < rR; u++) {
051                                if (roi.contains(u, v)) {
052                                        int p = ip.getPixel(u, v);
053                                        ip.putPixel(u, v, ~p);  // invert color values
054                                }
055
056                        }
057                }
058        }
059}
